description: The first step in creating new type schema in Synapse is to setup and configure an organization. The name of the organization servers as the root for each schema's $id managed by that organization.  The organization name ‘org.sagebionetworks’ is reserved for the core Synapse model objects.   Each organization also has an Access Control List (ACL) that controls who can add schemas to an organization.  All schemas created under an Organization will be considered publicly readable and reference-able. Organizations are immutable

id.description: The Synapse numberic identifier issued to the Organization.

name.description: The name of the organization servers as the root for each schema's $id managed under an organization, and each name must be unique. Organization names MUST start and end with with a letter ([A-Za-z]) and can contain digits [0-9] and periods ".".  The name must be 250 characters or less. Names are case insensitive.

createdOn.description: The date this Organziation was created.
createdOn.title: Created On

createdBy.description: The ID of the user that created this Organziation.
createdBy.title: Created By
